docs.snippet: Prof. Albert S. Bickmore gave his concluding lecture in the Spring course yesterday morning at the Museum of Natural History, under the auspices of the State Superintendent of Public Instruction, on "The Races and Foreign Buildings at the Paris...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prof. Albert S. Bickmore gave his concluding lecture in the Spring course yesterday morning at the Museum of Natural History, under the auspices of the State Superintendent of Public Instruction, on "The Races and Foreign Buildings at the Paris Exposition of 1889."

headline.main: GUESTS OF PROF. BICKMORE; WITH HIM THE TEACHERS LEASE OF THE PARIS EXPOSITION. Races and Foreign. Buildings More Partieularly Considered -- Through the "Avenne of Nations" -- Last of the Spring Coarse of Lectures Far from Being the Least Interesting -- Seventy-two Artistically-Colored Views Shown on the Screen.

docs.snippet: BUDA-PESTH, April 9 -- The lower house of the Reichstag discussed to-day the grievance of the newspaper reporters, who have been banished from the lobby and the restaurant by order of the President. Dr. Wekerle, Premier, warmly espoused the cause of...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUDA-PESTH, April 9 -- The lower house of the Reichstag discussed to-day the grievance of the newspaper reporters, who have been banished from the lobby and the restaurant by order of the President. Dr. Wekerle, Premier, warmly espoused the cause of the reporters, and demanded that they have every possible privilege.

headline.main: Made It Up with, the Reporters.

docs.snippet: MONTCLAIR, N.J., April 12 -- Over sixty cases of typhoid fever have so far developed here. Two deaths occurred to-day, making five in all since the first case was discovered, Harding A. Taylor died to-day. He was the milkman to whom G.M. Gould turned...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTCLAIR, N.J., April 12 -- Over sixty cases of typhoid fever have so far developed here. Two deaths occurred to-day, making five in all since the first case was discovered, Harding A. Taylor died to-day. He was the milkman to whom G.M. Gould turned over his customers after the State Dairy Commissioner had quarantined his farm.
docs.abstract: Rio Grande do Sul Not Captured by Insurgents

headline.main: VICTIMS OF TYPHOID FEVER.; Over Sixty Cases Have Developed in Montclair, N.J. -- Two Deaths Yesterday.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, April 14 -- The Brazilian rebellion has collapsed completely. The military forces of President Peixoto have driven the insurgents out of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, and the defeated and discomfited Admiral de Mello has disembarked...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, April 14 -- The Brazilian rebellion has collapsed completely. The military forces of President Peixoto have driven the insurgents out of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, and the defeated and discomfited Admiral de Mello has disembarked 1,500 insurgent troops on the frontier of Uruguay and surrendered himself and his command to the Uruguayan authorities, who have disarmed them.

headline.main: ADMIRAL MELLO SURRENDERS; TOTAL COLLAPSE OF THE REBELLION IN BRAZIL. De Mello Hands His Sword to a Military Officer of Uruguay and Is Placed Under Arrest, with His Followers -- Peixoto's Army Drives the Insurgents from Rio Grande do Sul -- Da Gama Protests Against His Treatment by the Portuguese.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: DA GAMA AND OFFICERS ESCAPE ON PORTUGUESE VESSEL

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 15. -- The Brazilian Minister received this afternoon, a cablegram from his Government confirming the latest news of the collapse of the rebellion in Brazil. The cablegram is as follows:
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 15. -- The Brazilian Minister received this afternoon, a cablegram from his Government confirming the latest news of the collapse of the rebellion in Brazil. The cablegram is as follows:

headline.main: THE COLLAPSE OF THE REVOLT.; The Flight of Mello Confirmed by a Dispatch to the Brazilian Minister.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 16. -- The Government is advised that Admiral Mello did not surrender himself to the Uruguayan authorities, but remained on board the Republica. It is said that it was his intention to surrender and that he offered to do so on...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 16. -- The Government is advised that Admiral Mello did not surrender himself to the Uruguayan authorities, but remained on board the Republica. It is said that it was his intention to surrender and that he offered to do so on condition that the authorities would not turn him over to the Brazilian Government.

headline.main: MELLO ON THE HIGH SEAS; HE DECLINED TO SURRENDER TO THE URUGUAY AUTHORITIES. Demanded a Pledge that He Would Not Be Returned to Brazil, Which Was Refused -- He Then Tried to Land at Rio Grande do Sul, but Was Repulsed -- Sailed Away on the Republica for an Unknown Destination -- Brazilian Bonds Advance.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 23. -- There is much comfort to Senators and those whose duties call them to the Senate chamber in the fact that at 5 o'clock to-morrow the agreement by which general debate has been had upon the Tariff bill will cease to be in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 23. -- There is much comfort to Senators and those whose duties call them to the Senate chamber in the fact that at 5 o'clock to-morrow the agreement by which general debate has been had upon the Tariff bill will cease to be in effect, and the bill will become then subject to amendment.

headline.main: GENERAL DEBATE TO CLOSE TO-DAY.; Mills to Make the Last Speech for the Bill -- Washburn on Reciprocity.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: UNITED STATES CONGRESS, FIFTY-THIRD. SECOND SESSION. COMPLETE

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 27 -- This is known as the cleanest city in the world. It is also said to enjoy greater immunity from disease than any other city In the Western Hemisphere. It is Taunt upon the easy-rising slope of a mount. The base of this...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 27 -- This is known as the cleanest city in the world. It is also said to enjoy greater immunity from disease than any other city In the Western Hemisphere. It is Taunt upon the easy-rising slope of a mount. The base of this mount is exposed, for the greater portion, to strong tidal effects, supplemented by the natural current of the Rio de la Plata River.
docs.abstract: Quarantine System; American Importations, &c.; Times's Letter

headline.main: NOT A BAD PLACE TO LIVE IN; MONTEVIDEO IS CLEAN, HEALTHY, AND OTHERWISE ATTRACTIVE. Picturesquely Built on the Slope of a Mountain -- A Quarantine System Which Is Almost Perfect Under the Direction of the Wavy Department -- Why the Cutter Grant Was Delayed -- Old Broadway Cars Stunning on the Streets of the City.

docs.snippet: The Spanish man-of-war Nautilus, Capt. Fernando Villamil, now in in this harbor, is one of several training ships in the navy of Spain. She has a crew of 183 officers and men, made up as follows: Nine officers and 32 midshipmen, including two...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish man-of-war Nautilus, Capt. Fernando Villamil, now in in this harbor, is one of several training ships in the navy of Spain. She has a crew of 183 officers and men, made up as follows: Nine officers and 32 midshipmen, including two Chileans. The seamen are of two classes, ordinary seamen and naval apprentices.

headline.main: SPAIN'S SCHOOLSHIP NAUTILUS; NOW IN THIS PORT ON HER LONG CRUISE SOUND THE WORLD. She Has Thirty-two Midshipmen and fifty-four Naval Apprentices on Board -- A Well-Trained and an Unusually Fine-Looking Body of Men -- Description of the Vessel and Her Armament -- To be Away from Home Nearly Two Years.

docs.snippet: Marshal Floriano Peixoto, Vice President of the Republic of the United States of Brazil, has addressed a patriotic message to the members of the National Congress on the occasion of the opening of the first session of the second Legislature.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marshal Floriano Peixoto, Vice President of the Republic of the United States of Brazil, has addressed a patriotic message to the members of the National Congress on the occasion of the opening of the first session of the second Legislature.
docs.abstract: Congress Opened; Vice President Peixoto's Message

headline.main: MARSHAL FLORIANO PEIXOTO'S MESSAGE.; Addressed to the National Congress, Reviews Brazil's Condition.
